comparison.title: Comparing Traditional Open Hysterectomy & Laparoscopic Hysterectomy

definition.title: What is Hysterectomy?
definition.content: Hysterectomy is a surgical procedure to remove all or part of a woman's uterus, and in some cases, the ovaries and fallopian tubes. It is performed to treat various conditions such as fibroids, endometriosis, cancer, or uterine prolapse.

symptoms.title: Indications for Hysterectomy
listItems: Cancer of the uterus, ovaries, or cervix

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Hysterectomy can be performed through different methods, including traditional open surgery, laparoscopic surgery, or robotic-assisted surgery. The choice of treatment depends on the patient's condition and the surgeon's recommendation.

prevention.title: Post-operative Care
listItems: Report any complications to your doctor
